name: Pork and Fennel Pasta
keywords: Pork and Fennel Pasta, Italian, Pork, Pasta, Spaghetti, Tomato Sauce, Capsicum, Fennel Seeds, Red Wine, Chilis, Thyme, Garlic, Parmesan
description: Rich saucy spaghetti with layers of flavor.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large pan/pot with a bit of olive oil. Add onion and fennel seeds and fry over medium heat, stirring, until soft. Add tomatoes and capsicum and cook, stirring regularly, until the capsicum is soft.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Add garlic, thyme, chilis, beef stock, and red wine. Simmer for about 40m. Blend lightly with a stick blender to get rid of the chunks. Keep simmering, add water if it gets too dry (or more wine).
recipeInstructions.name: Add more and simmer

recipeInstructions.text: Cut sausages into small bits and fry until they are crispy all over. Add sausage, oil, and fat from the pan to the sauce mix. Simmer for another 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Fry the sausage

recipeInstructions.text: While simmering for the last 10 minutes, cook your pasta to how you like it.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook pasta

recipeInstructions.text: Serve topped with cheese of your choice (I went with parmesan) and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

notes: You can use chorizo or bacon instead of pork and fennel sausage for a variation in flavor but damn is it good with fennel sausage.
Great with some melty cheese... mmm.
